pageContent: Objectives: Cancer is a complicated issue both medically and psychosocially, and the process of the disease affects the whole human being. Fatigue is the commonest symptom associated with cancer and its treatment. Prostate cancer is the third commonest male cancer worldwide and the leading cause of male cancer death. The aims of this study were: (i) to identify whether fatigue is found in men with newly diagnosed localized prostate cancer (predominantly early-stage, very low tumour burden asymptomatic patients); and (ii) to gain a perception of whether fatigue has an influence on these men and to try to find out what the cause of this fatigue was.

metaData.source:
Symptom and function profiles of men with localized prostate cancer
https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/29660795/
